result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricardo Maldonado

records.addlTxt: Atty Alexander Kostal- removed, defendant has private counsel.
State's NOI to Introduce Certd Public Records
State's NOI to Intro Deft's Statements
State's Motion to Admit 911 Recordings
Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim MES (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. Do not drive at all. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney John M Wagner appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Ricardo Maldonado appeared by video, in custody, Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter for Ricardo Maldonado appeared by video. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
